notesStmt.note: Folio 1r contains some doodles.A child's hand scribbling on folio 134r.In the left-hand lower corner of fse002v ([219v]) 'Masekhet bava ḳama' is written, showing that the contents of Add MS 26991 II followed those of Add MS 27134.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Abraham del Vecchio's Tiḳune ha-Rif on Seder Nashim and Masekhet Ḥulin.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th century, probably of Solomon Portaleone.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Del Vecchio. Tikkune ha-Riph. Part II. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,134.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 241: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [220v].
